claim_cards.claim: High-Re turbulence contains a conserved 1:2:3 harmonic structure detectable in data as a stable ratio pattern.
claim_cards.test_hook: Run the NT-distance ratio extraction on independent turbulence datasets; verify the same ratio-peak structure persists.
claim_cards.evidence_excerpt: a conserved 1:2:3 harmonic structure embedded in turbulence

claim_cards.claim: The 1:2:3 structure is extracted directly from JHTDB turbulence data using a Narrative Tick event-sampling approach.
claim_cards.test_hook: Recompute NT timestamps and ratio histograms from JHTDB series; check stability across probes and windows.
claim_cards.evidence_excerpt: Using the Johns Hopkins Turbulence Database (JHTDB)... We compute a time series of 'Narrative Ticks' (NTs)

claim_cards.claim: The ratio structure is reported as stable across probes and time windows, suggesting it is not a sampling artifact.
claim_cards.test_hook: Vary probe locations and window sizes; confirm ratio structure remains (qualitatively and quantitatively).
claim_cards.evidence_excerpt: stable across probes and time windows

claim_cards.claim: Narrative Ticks (NTs) are defined operationally as sign changes in the scalar signal derivative exceeding a sigma threshold.
claim_cards.test_hook: Implement NT detection exactly; verify detected NTs change predictably under σ sweeps (not random blow-up).
claim_cards.evidence_excerpt: an NT is detected as a sign change in the derivative of the scalar signal, exceeding a threshold σ

claim_cards.claim: The proposed signature is a histogram of ratios of consecutive NT distances; clustering indicates repeated physics.
claim_cards.test_hook: Compute NT distances d_i and ratios r_i=d_i/d_{i+1}; check whether histogram exhibits stable clusters.
claim_cards.evidence_excerpt: we compute their distances d_i and form ratios r_i = d_i / d_{i+1}

claim_cards.claim: NT distances appear in discrete ratio sets (quantized), rather than forming a continuous spectrum.
claim_cards.test_hook: Test discreteness by comparing to shuffled-NT controls; quantify peak prominence vs null.
claim_cards.evidence_excerpt: these NT distances cluster into discrete ratio sets

claim_cards.claim: A Kepler-style prediction is made: as harmonics stabilize, the NT-distance ratios should converge to conserved values.
claim_cards.test_hook: Track ratio histograms over time; test whether peaks sharpen/stabilize as the flow enters stable shedding regimes.
claim_cards.evidence_excerpt: the ratios between NT distances converge to conserved values

claim_cards.claim: The paper interprets stable ratio clusters as the Principle of Least Action expressing itself as a discrete rhythm in turbulence.
claim_cards.test_hook: Only apply this interpretation after demonstrating cross-run stability of the same ratio clusters.
claim_cards.evidence_excerpt: PoLA is not just a principle of motion—it is a principle of rhythmic selection

claim_cards.claim: The ratio signature is asserted to be scale-invariant: ratios are conserved under scaling transformations.
claim_cards.test_hook: Rescale the scalar signal (or compare different unit scalings) and confirm the ratio histogram remains unchanged.
claim_cards.evidence_excerpt: ratios are conserved under a scaling transformation

claim_cards.claim: The rhythm is positioned as directly extractable from measured data without solving Navier–Stokes PDEs.
claim_cards.test_hook: Demonstrate end-to-end extraction on measured / DNS data using only the scalar time series.
claim_cards.evidence_excerpt: You don’t need to solve the PDE to see the law—you need to extract the ticks

claim_cards.claim: The approach is explicitly framed as complementing—not replacing—Navier–Stokes.
claim_cards.test_hook: State benchmark comparisons as ‘added predictive signal’ rather than ‘replacement’; evaluate side-by-side.
claim_cards.evidence_excerpt: This does not replace Navier–Stokes. It adds a missing layer

claim_cards.claim: Reproducibility is claimed via open tools and open datasets hosted with code on GitHub.
claim_cards.test_hook: Clone repo + run the extraction pipeline; verify you can regenerate the ratio histogram from referenced datasets.
claim_cards.evidence_excerpt: open tools and open datasets, hosted on GitHub
